metadata.title: CVE-2022-25313 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.5, an attacker can trigger stackexhaustion in build_model via a large nesting depth in the DTD element.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25313` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.2.9-1ubuntu0.4
libexpat1 - 2.2.9-1ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.9-1ubuntu0.4').
xmlrpc-c package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
wbxml2 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
cadaver package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
matanza: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
tdom package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by upstream in new versions').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by upstream in new versions').
